title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Swayman humorously addressed the regrettable goal, citing colorblindness amidst speculation about black ice boards.
Despite allowing two goals, the U.S. offense led the team to victory; Swayman made 18 saves.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is recovering from an Achilles injury, considering a return in the NBA season's latter half.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express confidence in Tatum's potential impact upon return to the Celtics.
Tatum has been practicing, including with the Celtics' G League team, signaling a possible return in coming weeks.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million cap space to pursue free agents in 2026.
Colts WR Alec Pierce considered a strong option; led NFL in yards per reception in 2024 and 2025.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker identified as top left tackle option for Patriots in free agency.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season; non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free ESPN month.
ESPN Unlimited costs $29.99 monthly or $299.99 yearly; MLB.TV requires registration via the ESPN app for new subscribers.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are auto-renewed; they can access games via the MLB or ESPN app without ESPN Unlimited subscription.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics’ Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, generating speculation of his return from an Achilles tear.
Ron Harper Jr. commented on Tatum’s performance, noting he looked like himself during the G League practice.
Tatum’s status remains unchanged on the injury report, with no confirmed timeline for his potential season return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 study with top marks in higher education and public schools.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate degree, leading the nation.
Vermont and Maryland rank second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia are the least educated states.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Honus Wagner's rare T206 baseball card is on auction, a unique piece kept ungraded by family for 116 years.
The card, featuring ties to a Taunton silver factory family, currently has a bid of $3.9 million, plus buyer's premium.
Auction hosted by Ken Goldin, Netflix star and collectibles expert, showcasing Goldin's connections to New England's collectible culture.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics, his first Olympic appearance.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, going 5-0 with a shutout in the final.
Swayman's Bruins teammate, Charlie McAvoy, will also play against Denmark, joining him on Team USA's Olympic roster.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead on a barrier island off Virginia's Eastern Shore.
The whale, identified as Porcia's 2023 calf, is the second right whale fatality in two weeks.
This death is part of NOAA’s ongoing investigation into the North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children in Massachusetts have died from flu-related causes this season, according to state health officials.
A total of 260 flu-related deaths have occurred in Massachusetts, including 253 adults and seven children.
Health officials urge vaccination due to flu strain on hospitals, especially recommending it for vulnerable populations.
